entries.meaning: The state of being out of proportion; an abnormal or improper ratio; an imbalance.
examples: […]  a handsome creature, remarkably so, with features so symmetrical  […]  that a micrometer gauge could scarcely find a disproportion in her smooth and broad mahogany-coloured face.

entries.meaning: Lack of suitableness, adequacy, or due proportion to an end or use; unsuitableness.
examples: the disproportion of strength or means to an object

verbs.description: disproportion (third-person singular simple present disproportions, present participle disproportioning, simple past and past participle disproportioned)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To make unsuitable in quantity, form, or fitness; to violate symmetry in; to mismatch.
